Package ru.nsu.fit.smolyakov.pizzeria.pizzeria.workers.warehouse

Interface Warehouse

All Known Implementing Classes:
WarehouseImpl
public interface Warehouse
Represents an FIFO warehouse in a pizzeria. Allows to put(Order)} awaiting orders in it and takeMultiple(int) items from one.

Can be started, stopped or force stopped.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    forceStop()
    Removes all contained orders from the warehouse and lets the reception go home right now.
    boolean
    isEmpty()
    Returns if there are more orders in a warehouse.
    void
    put(Order order)
    Puts an order in a queue.
    void
    start()
    Initiates the warehouse.
    void
    stopAfterCompletion()
    Allows the warehouse workers go home.
    Queue<Order>
    takeMultiple(int maxAmount)
    Takes some orders from the queue.

  • Method Details

    • put

      void put(Order order)
      Puts an order in a queue.

      This operation is blocking: if queue capacity is exhausted, execution stops until previous statement won't become false.

      Parameters:
      order - a specified order to put into queue

    • takeMultiple

      Queue<Order> takeMultiple(int maxAmount)
      Takes some orders from the queue.

      This operation is blocking: if queue is empty, execution stops until previous statement won't become false.

      Parameters:
      maxAmount - a maximum amount of pizzas a delivery guy can bring with him (usually limited by his trunk capacity)
      Returns:
      an order from the top of the queue
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if maxAmount is less than 1.

    • start

      void start()
      Initiates the warehouse.

    • forceStop

      void forceStop()
      Removes all contained orders from the warehouse and lets the reception go home right now.

    • stopAfterCompletion

      void stopAfterCompletion()
      Allows the warehouse workers go home. It is supposed that delivery boys will deliver all pizzas before they also will be able to go home.

    • isEmpty

      boolean isEmpty()
      Returns if there are more orders in a warehouse.
      Returns:
      true if there are more orders in a warehouse
